title: A Trip to the Moon
description: A group of astronomers go on an expedition to the Moon.

title: The Great Train Robbery
description: A group of bandits stage a brazen train hold-up, only to find themselves pursued by a posse of local lawmen.

title: The Impossible Voyage
description: An expedition attempts to reach the sun using a variety of vehicles.

title: The Man with the Rubber Head
description: A chemist swells his head to enormous proportions with a bellows.

title: The Kingdom of Fairies
description: A prince must rescue his betrothed princess from a witch who has carried her off.

title: Fantasmagorie
description: One of the earliest examples of traditional hand-drawn animation, featuring a stick figure moving through morphing objects.

title: The Big Swallow
description: A gentleman, irritated by the presence of a photographer, opens his mouth wide and swallows the camera and operator whole.

title: The Infernal Cauldron
description: A demon throws three women into a cauldron and is subsequently haunted by their ghosts.

title: The One-Man Band
description: A magician duplicates himself into a seven-man band.

title: Bluebeard
description: A rich nobleman forbids his new wife from entering a secret room in his castle.

title: The Eclipse: Courtship of the Sun and Moon
description: An astronomer views a solar eclipse in which the Sun and Moon flirt with one another.

title: A Corner in Wheat
description: A greedy tycoon manipulates the price of wheat for his own profit, devastating the poor who can no longer afford bread.

title: Alice in Wonderland
description: The first film adaptation of Lewis Carroll's classic book about a girl who falls down a rabbit hole.

title: Life of an American Fireman
description: One of the earliest American narrative films, depicting the rescue of a woman and child from a burning building.

title: The Merry Frolics of Satan
description: Satan creates chaos on Earth with magical trunks and a carriage ride through the stars.

title: The Dancing Pig
description: A vaudeville act featuring a large, anthropomorphic pig that dances with a girl.

title: Humorous Phases of Funny Faces
description: Generally cited as the first animated film recorded on standard picture film, featuring a cartoonist drawing faces on a chalkboard that come to life.

title: Rescued by Rover
description: A dog leads its master to find his kidnapped baby in a groundbreaking film for continuity editing.

title: The ? Motorist
description: A motorist and his passenger drive up the side of a building and into space, circling the rings of Saturn.

title: The Lonely Villa
description: A wealthy family is terrorized by burglars while the father is lured away on a false pretenses, leading to a race against time to save them.

title: The Mermaid
description: A gentleman tries to fill his aquarium with fish, but a mermaid appears instead, teasing him.

title: Dream of a Rarebit Fiend
description: A man eats a Welsh rarebit and drinks ale, which leads to a night of wild, surreal hallucinations.

title: The Story of the Kelly Gang
description: Generally considered the world's first feature-length narrative film, depicting the life of Australian bushranger Ned Kelly.

title: The Haunted House
description: Travelers take refuge in an old house, where they are tormented by supernatural occurrences and moving furniture.

title: Princess Nicotine; or, The Smoke Fairy
description: A smoker falls asleep and is tormented by two fairies who play tricks with his pipe and tobacco.

title: The Golden Beetle
description: A magician throws a golden beetle into a cauldron, transforming it into a fountain of fire and winged women.

title: The Assassination of the Duke of Guise
description: A historical drama famous for being one of the first films to feature an original score written by Camille Saint-Saëns.

title: The Country Doctor
description: A doctor must choose between attending to his sick daughter or saving the life of a neighbor's child.

title: The Red Spectre
description: A demonic magician in a red cave performs incredible tricks involving fire and levitation.

title: Tunneling the English Channel
description: King Edward VII and President Fallières dream of a tunnel connecting England and France, and watch the construction begin.

title: The Living Playing Cards
description: A magician brings playing cards to life in this early trick film.

title: The 400 Tricks of the Devil
description: An engineer sells his soul to the Devil for magical powers and embarks on a frantic adventure.

title: The Night Before Christmas
description: An early film adaptation of the classic poem showing Santa Claus preparing for his Christmas Eve journey.

title: Joan of Arc
description: An early silent film depicting the life and execution of Joan of Arc.

title: The Seven Ages
description: A series of vignettes illustrating the seven stages of a courtship and marriage.

title: The Black Imp
description: A hotel guest is tormented by a mischievous imp who makes furniture disappear and reappear.

title: The Gay Shoe Clerk
description: A shoe clerk flirts with a female customer by revealing her ankle, but gets caught by her chaperone.

title: The Sealed Room
description: A king exacts a terrible revenge on his unfaithful queen and her lover by sealing them inside a windowless room.

title: Scrooge, or, Marley's Ghost
description: The earliest known film adaptation of Charles Dickens's 1843 novella A Christmas Carol.

title: Visit to the Seaside
description: A short film significant for being the first commercially successful motion picture in natural color, using the Kinemacolor process.

title: The Thieving Hand
description: A beggar receives an artificial limb that has a mind of its own and proceeds to pickpocket passersby.

title: Jack and the Beanstalk
description: An early narrative adaptation of the classic fairy tale featuring a giant beanstalk and a castle in the clouds.

title: The Untamable Whiskers
description: A man attempts to draw a picture of a woman on a blackboard, but his own face changes rapidly and uncontrollably.

title: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves
description: An early hand-colored film depicting the Arabian Nights tale.

title: The Devilish Tenant
description: A new tenant unpacks his furniture from a single suitcase, but the furniture soon begins to move and disappear on its own.

title: L'Enfant prodigue
description: The first feature-length motion picture produced in Europe, adapting the stage play 'The Prodigal Son' without intertitles.
